docs.snippet: Now, anyone expressing ideas unacceptable to the new militant nationalism faces an inquisition or violence.
Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.
docs.abstract: Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.

docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the responsibility of a community in a member’s time of need, when to push back on friends’ vile online commentary and more.

headline.print_headline: What Should We Have Told a Betrayed Wife?
headline.main: What Should a Congregation Have Told a Betrayed Wife?

docs.snippet: Farhad and Mike discuss the week’s biggest tech events, including Mark Zuckerberg’s founder’s letter and the fall of a YouTube star.

headline.print_headline: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: A Letter From Zuckerberg and the Fall of PewDiePie
headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: A Letter From Zuckerberg and the Fall of PewDiePie

docs.snippet: With Facebook and some of its top apps trying to tap into popular features pioneered by Snapchat, WhatsApp unveiled a version of its Status feature that focuses on sharing images.

headline.print_headline: WhatsApp’s New Feature Continues Facebook’s Snapchat Mimicry
headline.main: WhatsApp’s New Feature Continues Facebook’s Snapchat Mimicry

docs.snippet: While Facebook ponders its place in the news industry, tech companies try to stay on the good side of the president-elect.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Thiel, Tech Companies and Trump

docs.snippet: The free app, which Facebook owns, is offering another vehicle to advertisers, who since late 2015 have been buying space on its original photo feed.

headline.print_headline: More Ads Coming to Instagram, This Time in Its Stories Feature
headline.main: More Ads to Appear on Instagram, Now on ‘Stories’ Feature

docs.snippet: Mike Isaac live-tweeted Mark Zuckerberg’s testimony at a federal court last week — until it almost got him booted from the courtroom.

headline.print_headline: A Trial and a Twitterstorm: On Live-Tweeting From a Federal Courthouse
headline.main: A Trial and a Twitterstorm: On Live-Tweeting From a Federal Courthouse

docs.snippet: In this week’s Oz newsletter, the search for audience loyalty, in journalism and right-wing populism.
While immigration, health care and Russia are hogging the media oxygen, big reversals are happening in Obama-era tech policy.

headline.print_headline: Farhad’s and Cecilia’s Week in Tech: Tech Policy, Too, Is Undergoing a Sea Change
headline.main: Farhad’s and Cecilia’s Week in Tech: Tech Policy, Too, Is Undergoing a Sea Change
